intro: Dryandra concinna, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is an evergreen shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. It is a member of the genus Dryandra, which is known for its diverse and often striking floral displays. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
